oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Eddy Arnold and Bill Givens interview - Part 2 - 1956-01-28
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of a recorded interview between Bill Givens and Eddy Arnold, in Philadelphia, PA on January 28, 1956. Discussion topics include how Eddy Arnold first heard the song I'll Hold You In My Heart (Till I Can Hold You In My Arms) and Eddy's record sales in the Eastern United States. For Part 1, refer to TR003867_1. For Part 3, refer to TR003867_2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddy Arnold
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Eddy Arnold talks about his song, "Richest Man (In The World)," written by Boudleaux Bryant / (1:22) Recording of Eddy Arnold's "Richest Man (In The World)" / (3:45) Chock Full O'Nuts Coffee advertisement / (4:40) Bill Givens and Eddy Arnold talk about Eddy's song, "I'll Hold You In My Heart (Till I Can Hold You In My Arms)," written by Eddy Arnold, Hall Horton, and Thomas Dilbeck / (7:24) Recording of Eddy Arnold's "I'll Hold You In My Heart (Till I Can Hold You In My Arms)" [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008
